fields.description: When opting into the beta projects feature repos having brackets (i.e. "(" or ")") in their names aren't moved to the default project, remaining in limbo. You can't even move these repos one by one to a project by going their admin screens, the only way to resolve this is to move them from the repository selector of an empty project.
fields.summary: Repositories having brackets in their name aren't moved to the default project (BB-15374)

fields.description: Hitting Save under the editor of an existing project yields "Something went wrong.".
fields.summary: Trying to edit existing project yields error

fields.description: I'd consider this a bug: when you open a repo that corresponds to a project (so basically every repo after you enable the beta projects feature) then the project logo will be displayed in the upper left corner. However what would be meaningful here is the repo logo.
fields.summary: Show repository logo on the repo page instead of project logo (BB-15375)

fields.description:
.svg is not rendered in a wiki page (using .rst markup ).

In that page image is not displayed (however space is reserved, but not clickable and no alt-text), however if you click in a link to the image all is OK.
fields.summary: Fix svg rendering in bitbucket wiki (BB-15354)

fields.description:
That's it. Usually name of repository owner (team or user) was shown above repository name (to the right of repo icon). Now it's missed.

!97561720-bitbucket-master.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Name of repository owner is no longer shown on repository page (BB-15360)

fields.description:
It would be very useful to see an extra column on the Pull Requests page which states the destination branch for the PR.

This would enable the person responsible for the destination branch to see what pulls are being requested at a glance.
fields.summary: Show pull request destination on PR page

fields.description:
We are using the passport-bitbucket library to allow our users to log in to our site via bitbucket authentication.

Tonight, for some reason logins started to fail with this message:

{code}
failed to obtain request token (status: 403 data: This endpoint does not support token-based authentication)
{code}

Has something recently changed in the endpoint to cause this?

I believe the endpoint it is referring to is this: https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/oauth/request_token/
fields.summary: oauth authentication failing suddenly(BB-15346)

fields.description:
When I enter repository page, I want to see the list of branches. But it takes time to load it to the page, which I don't mind. The problem that there is no indication that it is loaded or not loaded. So I had to click for several seconds, to check whether it was loaded or not.

So if I have hundreds of branches - it takes time to deliver them from server, which is reasonable. The thing which would work for me - is to add a spinning wheel or some indicator, that shows, that branches list is still loading, so I won't have to click several times to check whether list is available or not yet. It's only a UX question. Technically it works perfect.
fields.summary: Display feedback when loading branch/tag lists on repo overview

fields.description:
In my repository, I have limited access to the 'develop' branch.\\
Pushes are limited to the Administrators and the Developers group.\\
The Administrators group has admin access to the repo, the 'Developer' group has write access.

This worked fine until recently.\\
Now users who are members of one or both groups cannot push to the develop branch.\\
They get the following:

{code}

Compressing objects: 100% (13/13), done.
Writing objects: 100% (16/16), 1.66 KiB | 0 bytes/s, done.
Total 16 (delta 7), reused 0 (delta 0)
remote: permission denied to update branch develop
To git@bitbucket.org:omroepntr/wetenschap-ntr-nl.git
! [remote rejected] develop -> develop (pre-receive hook declined)
error: failed to push some refs to 'git@bitbucket.org:omroepntr/wetenschap-ntr-nl.git'
Counting: command not found

{code}

I can push just fine. I am also in those groups, but am also included as 'admin' user on the repository.\\
If I remove the develop push limits, people can push, but obviously I want the restrictions to work. As far as I can see, all rights have been set properly (as indicated above).
fields.summary: Permission denied to update branch

fields.description:
If creating a pull request and there are changes (added description, reviewers, etc.), it'll be good if Bitbucket can prompt a confirmation box first before navigating away from the page.

This will help users to not accidentally be navigated away and lose all work.

(Sorta like when you're writing a status on facebook and you try to navigate, it'll confirm first.)
fields.summary: Prompt before navigating away from a PR with unsaved changes

fields.description: ADFS integration with Bit Bucket.
fields.summary: ADFS integration with Bit Bucket. (BB-15435)

fields.description:
Hi All,

Just got this error now, something a bit screwed from Bitbucket.org end, server returning Internal Server Error 500 doing a PULL request from a branch I'm on, can email details it's actually returning a not found for a particular repo/change set/branch by the looks of it, the Error happens contacting:

https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/repositories/<our company account>/<repo name>/<changeset hash>=<some other number>

This is a repo we've been using for a few weeks now without issue, but suddenly now (12:20 on 15th December 2015) it gives:

Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 500

The JSON for this resource is actually returning:

{"error": {"message": "[Errno 2] No such file or directory", "id": "1a3ed1be886a4cab847b4f9fe4807d37"}}

So I would suggest some better error handling here, since interally on Bitbuckets website you actually know the source of the error (unless you have some kind of mailer set up and just displaying the message to the end user- which is simply "An unexpected error occured") .

Either way, would be keen to understand how we ended up here and how to resolve,

Kind regards

Roger Davies
fields.summary: Internal Server Error on Pull Request

fields.description:
Hi,

Im not sure why, i have pushed a branch to bitbucket but when i try to create a pull request to i can merge with the master branch i am getting an Unexpected error, i have attached a screenshot.
fields.summary: Pull request Unexpected error
Edit pull request : "an unexpected error occurred"
oauth /user call failing for `https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0`

fields.description:
Hi,

We have a repository:\\
https://bitbucket.org/macrosoftphonegap/dayworks-client

It was displaying the message that the repository's size is over 1 GB. I cleaned it using BFG repo cleaner. Today it's saying that the repo's size has increased over 2GB.

I've taken a fresh clone of repo and using command:\\
git count-objects -vH\\
the size-pack is turned out to be 254.06 MiB

Can you please check why bitbucket is still showing me error of over 2GB.\\
Also, this repository doesn't contain large files. Most of the size was occupied by .git folder before cleaning.

May be you need to run gc on your end.

Please help!\\
Umair
fields.summary: Repository size not getting reduced on bitbucket after cleanup

fields.description:
For source files in Restructured Text format, Bitbucket source browser shows interpreted text (text between backwards apostrophes) in italic (which is fine) and with a long dash before the text (which is somewhat weird as the source text does not contain dashes there, and also other ResT viewers do not show any dashes).

See for example [this example|https://bitbucket.org/aradi/fortyxima-dev/src/a5fd8ea501528457db9f26d24bfc332fa0c597d1/doc/devel/guide/gitworkflow.rst%3Fat%3Ddevelop%26fileviewer%3Dfile-view-default], the word {{master}} in the first list entry.
fields.summary: Unnecessary dashes placed in front of `cite` elements when using backticks in rst

fields.summary: Clone all repositories in one account with a button. (BB-15634)

Instead of showing the avatar, some people are getting 502s or "We cannot complete this request, remote data was invalid"

fields.description:
Currently BitBucket allows users to create new file by means of inplace text editor only.

It would be much more convenient if it'll also support standard file upload feature.

fields.description:
Some time ago BitBucket introduced a new function to Rename files in repository via web UI. It's strange that the function is available for text files only.

I'd suggest to allow renaming any file regardless of its type.
fields.summary: Renaming binary files via web UI

fields.description: After setting up a repository with the twitter hook, no actual information is being passed to Twitter, and no commits are shown on the timeline.
fields.summary: Twitter hook no longer sends commits to twitter timeline (BB-15261)

fields.description:
As suggested in [issue 12051|BCLOUD-12051], I have been attempting to use the undocumented v2.0 API /refs endpoint to fetch tags and branches from a repo that has a lot of them.

The branch and tag data returned by this endpoint looks fine, however the pagination of the results is not working properly.  The "pagelen" field always appears to be returning a value of 10 regardless of the size of the "values" list (which itself seems to be correct), and also the "next" field is being returned even in cases where there is no additional branch/tag data remaining.

(In this case, calling the "next" URL returns a result that (correctly) has an empty "values" but yet still includes the "next" field.  So I currently don't have any way to programmatically determine when the end of the result set has been reached.)
fields.summary: Pagination on new /refs API endpoint not working properly (BB-15267)

fields.description: Hi i am trying to push my project into bitbucket from terminal, when i go to source i see all my files except .xcodeproj. can anyone help?
fields.summary: can't upload .xcodeproj

I am not double-clicking the Send button, this happens on the first try.

Thanks

fields.description:
I run into this issue for a long time, so I surprised I could not find bug report about it (or maybe I'm bad at searching).

Go to some repo, go to Source page, browse into some directory. Try to go back from it using browser back button. Url changes, but the page stays the same.\\
Issue may disappear if I manually click on parent directory, but it gets back again if I reload the page (F5).\\
Tried in Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox.

fields.description:
I like creating [task lists|https://github.com/blog/1375%250A-task-lists-in-gfm-issues-pulls-comments] in markdown files, I believe this provides a clean and intuitive way to show what features/functionality is already implemented and or missing.\\
Coming from github to bitbucket I was disappointed the READMEs don't render the tasklists correctly in the repo overview.

I would really appreciate it if we could get support for this.

searching for changes\\

[command returned code 255 Thu Dec 03 09:49:22 2015]\\
Beta%

Here is what we get when trying to run from the command line

(dev) C:\bitbucket\Beta>hg push\\
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/...\\
searching for changes\\
remote: abort: abandoned transaction found - run hg recover!\\

(dev) C:\bitbucket\Beta>hg recover\\
no interrupted transaction available

Thanks

fields.description:
We have developers who are already using Bitbucket, and so we want to use it as an authentication provider for some other developer-centric web applications.

Currently Bitbucket lists the unverified email addresses attached to a username, thus someone can claim to have an email address from our company's domain.

This is a major security problem - please at least filter out unverified emails.
fields.summary: When used as an OAuth authentication provider, Bitbucket should not list unverified email addresses (BB-15203)

fields.description: BitBucket sends emails on pull request updates which a user is watching. The problem is that these pull-request-related-commit-notifications are just far too spammy. User should be able to enable or disable the notifications they want to receive regarding the pull-requests they are watching. For example a user just wants to receive the notifications when some other user comments on a pull request and not the commit notifications related to pull request.
fields.summary: More fine-grain control over what notifications are received from watching pull requests (BB-15171)

fields.description: Currently, the only short domain we allow is reserved for localhost -- no other intranet domains are valid because of Django's URL validation.
fields.summary: Allow for intranet domains when using build status API (BB-15204)

fields.description:
In the Transfer repository web page, the text should be :

Enter a username *or Team* below to send a transfer request. Once accepted, ownership of that repository will be reassigned to that user *or Team*.

Label "username" could be "username or Team".
fields.summary: Feature Request - Label on Transfer Repository web page (BB-15206)

fields.description: Please add an option to allow us to "un-grey-out" merges. I do not want to see a merge greyed out, because it is where we merge back to master, and our release numbers are there.
fields.summary: Merges are greyed out

fields.description:
There should be an API where in I can read email addresses of members in my team.\\
It is good for doing security audits and user access management as atlassian usernames are not a good identifiers.

You can give it to users who have admin access.

Reference: BBS-25225
fields.summary: BitBucket API - Get email addresses of my team members (BB-15207)

fields.description: One common problem we have is people unknowingly pushing up very large commits / diffs to the server. After a certain size (or number of lines), we'll give up and throw a 500 error. This is related to: BCLOUD-7723 however, we're not looking for a solution -- maybe just a better message to show people that their diff will not show on the UI due to the commit size
fields.summary: Friendlier web UI message for large commits (BB-15156)

fields.description:
Our git usage is as follows: we have a master branch and for each feature we create a feature branch. When a developer wants to merge its feature to master, it has to create a pull request. Each pull request is automatically built and tested by Jenkins which then approves commit (we use Bitbucket pull request builder plugin for Jenkins). After Jenkins approves the commit, the developer is free to merge the pull request into master.

However, we are facing the following problem: two developers want to merge two features in the same time. They both create a pull request, and Jenkins builds, tests and approves both pull requests. Then they both (not knowing about each other), click merge and we get two merge commits in master.\\
Since we do not like merge commits that are not direct result of fast forward merge because we want to have linear git history, we expect all our developers to have their feature branches rebased on master branch. However, when both developers merge their pull requests into master, one merge is expected fast-forward merge, and another is non-fast-forward merge (the second pull request actually gets updated, but our developers unfortunately do not pay attention to this, although we ask them to).

We would like to know how we can setup Bitbucket to automatically decline pull requests that are not fast forwards.
fields.summary: Automatically decline non-fast-forward pull requests

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user compares two tags or two branches in a repository, the 'Merged pull requests' tab shows an error if there is a merged pull request.\\
If there is no merged pull request, then no error occurs, the user sees an empty list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new repository in Bitbucket.
# Clone the repository locally.
# Create a file.
# Commit the file >> Add a tag V1 to this commit.
# Create a new branch called test_branch.
# Checkout the new branch.
# Create a second file.
# Commit file.
# Push commits and tags to Bitbucket.
# Create a PR to merge test_branch into master.
# Merge the above PR.
# Pull changes locally.
# Add a tag V2 to the merge commit.
# Push tags to Bitbucket.
# In Bitbucket, go to Compare.
# Compare master and test_branch.
# Compare tag V1 and tag V2.
# For both steps, 16 and 17, check 'Merged pull requests' tab.

h3. Expected Results
The tab should show a list of the merged pull requests.

h3. Actual Results
The tab shows:

Error

We were unable to load this page

h3. Notes
This occurs in both Git and Mercurial repos.

May be related to this: [Issue 11273|BCLOUD-11273]
fields.summary: Viewing 'Merged Pull reuqests' tab in Compare page shows an error when there is a merged pull request (BB-15151)

fields.description:
Team,

It will be helpful if we can have checks for merge requests like the ones that are provided in bitbucket server found in following links:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/checks-for-merging-pull-requests-776640039.html?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fconfluence.atlassian.com%2Fbitbucketserver%2Fchecks-for-merging-pull-requests-776640039.html&application=cac

Else you can let us know if there are already some predefined checks available in bitbucket cloud
fields.summary: Provision of checks for merge requests (BB-15210)

fields.summary: Repo size is wrong. Can't fix it

fields.description:
I am logged in with my bitbucket account. However in order to be able to post a comment on a page like this one:

http://blog.bitbucket.org/2015/11/18/introducing-the-build-status-api-for-bitbucket-cloud/

I have to log in with some other account (eg. Gmail). It would be better if I can just stay logged in.
fields.summary: Cannot post a blog comment with my Bitbucket account (BB-15213)

fields.description:
Right now, a regular part of my team's work flow is to break a feature into a couple Pull Requests in order to keep requests manageable.

An example:

* Branch {{develop}} into {{FEAT-123_BasicImpl}} and set up a Pull Request
* Branch {{FEAT-123_BasicImpl}} into {{FEAT-124_Extend123}} with another Pull Request
* Merge {{FEAT-123_BasicImpl}} when ready
* Go manually update {{FEAT-124_Extend123}} to point at {{develop}}
* Merge {{FEAT-124_Extend123}} when ready

Because often different developers are on {{FEAT-123}} and {{FEAT-124}}, the manual update step is often forgotten causing broken pull requests.

My request is that when a Pull Request is merged and if it is set to delete the branch, then any existing Pull Requests which reference the branch to be closed get updated to point at whichever branch it was merged into.
fields.summary: Update dependent PR destinations when merging and closing a PR that is a target

fields.description:
Hi,\\
when I try to clone a remote bitbucket Mercurial repo with SourceTree in Windows, I get "This is not a valid source path / URL".

Starting from the same UI windows (earth button) I'm able to create a new remote bitbucket  repo, so it seems that the proxy and user credentials are fine.\\
Something similar happens with Tortoise.
fields.summary: SourceTree clone remote repository problems

fields.description:
Branch should be created from "second":

!2032685710-jira.JPG|thumbnail!

However, it ends back to be created from "master":

!2282982823-jira2.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Creating branch from JIRA with a different branch parent will end up with branch parent reverting back to default. (BB-15109)

fields.description:
Hello - we have a private repository (http://bitbucket.org/dittolabs/ditto-cnn/) that got a 1GB warning recently. I used the BFG repo cleaner and pruned / cleaned / deleted a lot of the repo. On the bitbucket page, I still get the 1GB warning and the repo size claims to be 1.8GB. When I clone a fresh copy, it is still very tiny. Running git count-objects -v yields the following:

count: 0\\
size: 0\\
in-pack: 7732\\
packs: 1\\
size-pack: 1343\\
prune-packable: 0\\
garbage: 0\\
size-garbage: 0

It would be nice to know that my pruning / filtering worked right, but it seems that the file size on Bitbucket never changes. Is it possible that Bitbucket needs to run git-gc on their servers to re-calculate the repo size? If so, what do I need to do to make this happen?
fields.summary: Bitbucket repository size not updating

fields.description:
Hello, my repository is https://bitbucket.org/josh_crosby/.dotfiles and says it is over 1 GB, doing google searches, it appears this is the preferred way to resolve the issue.

~/.dotfiles ❯❯❯ git count-objects -vH\\
count: 0\\
size: 0 bytes\\
in-pack: 618\\
packs: 1\\
size-pack: 52.31 MiB\\
prune-packable: 0\\
garbage: 0\\
size-garbage: 0 bytes
fields.summary: Bitbucket says size over 1GB

fields.description:
I've got same anchor words on a wiki page, which should link to different URIs. E.g.

{code}
#!restructuredtext
`text<alias1_>`_

.. somewhere else

`text<alias2_>`_

.. _alias1: http://uri1.com/
.. _alias2: http://uri2.com/
{code}

The problem is that parser treats that aliases as an embedded URI, not as URI alias. As a result I get links to the non existent wiki pages "alias1_" and "alias2_".

Is that behaviour an intentional simplification?

Here is a link to [the concerned reST spec|http://docutils.sourceforge.net/docs/ref/rst/restructuredtext.html#embedded-uris-and-aliases].
fields.summary: At the bitbucket wiki reStructuredText URI aliases don't work (BB-15215)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While viewing the list of Issues in an Issue Tracker, if the user presses the column header Votes, then the Issues list becomes invisible.

This breaks the ability for the user to see the list of Issues in any Bitbucket repository - Issue Tracker as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a repository that has an Issue Tracker.
# Select Issues.
# While viewing the list of Issues, press the column Votes.

h3. Expected Results
The Issues list is sorted by the number of Votes.

h3. Actual Results
The list of Issues becomes invisible in this particular Issue Tracker, and also in any other Issue Tracker the user has access to. See screenshot attached below:

!230179666-Screen%20Shot%202015-11-20%20at%2015.06.17.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Pressing the column header Votes in the Issue Tracker, results in the Issues list becoming invisible (BB-15077)

fields.description:
I have Bitbucket in my bookmark toolbar. When I click it and it loads, the favicon of the bookmark gets inverted (the favicon of the tab remains ok).

This is how it changes:\\
!3676894786-bitbucket%20lol.PNG|thumbnail!

If I click it again, it returns the correct favicon. And so on.
fields.summary: Bitbucket favicon in bookmarks gets mad

fields.description:
Hello I have a repository that exceeded the limit, but i've already removed the many files and should be under the limit by now.

Why is it not reflecting on the bitbucket status?
fields.summary: Repository size exceeded 1 gb

fields.description:
Facing issues linking up jenkins with bitbucket.

We have setup a jenkins user with necessary build privilege.  Curl command triggers the build correctly with the below URL.

http://autobuild:apiToken@myjenkins.com:8080/job/BQJobs-1.41/build?token=BUILDTOKEN

It fails when I add this URL to the bitbucket and trigger it via the webhook plugin.  How should I configure the webhook so that it triggers whenever there is a merge in the master plugin ?

P.S. : There is no network issue.  Error is scrambled html+js couldn't get much info out of it.
fields.summary: bitbucket webhook with jenkins

fields.description: After the change to what seems to be Google reCAPTCHA, it is no longer possible to sign up for accounts from China. The captcha never loads (since Google is blocked), and the "Sign up" button stays disabled. (As a workaround, it is possible to use a VPN to sign up, but not everyone have access to that.)
fields.summary: Provide CAPTCHA alternative for creating Bitbucket accounts inside China
Cannot clone new repository with SourceTree

Hi bitbucket team,\\
unfortunately we committed a large file into our repository. And we're trying to remove this file from repository but we're getting this error when we sending delete commit here in web administration: "We had trouble committing your changes."

Repository: https://bitbucket.org/esdhorak/shh/\\
File: shh / shh-20151117.tar

Thanks,\\
ES team
fields.summary: I cannot delete large file from repository

fields.description:
When a Connect add-on renders an iframe in the repository overview page via a {{webPanel}} module, it would be useful to know the current user's level of access to that repository so that the appropriate content can be shown.

One convenient way to do this would be to add a new context parameter called something like {{user_repo_access}} or {{user_permission}} to the [existing set of context parameters|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/bitbucket-connect-docs/src/2fabfd295ff7e81adf6698f1dabe326d6f3ff75b/public/concepts/context-parameters.md%3Ffileviewer%3Dfile-view-default], some of which are already specific to repositories. The value of this parameter would be one of the permission levels currently checked by the [{{has_permission}} condition|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/24289662/answers/30949386], i.e. {{read}}, {{write}}, or {{admin}}.

Even if the user's access to the repo can be obtained via a REST call, exposing it as a context parameter would:

* be much more convenient for add-on developers,
* make add-ons much more performant and robust at runtime due to fewer network calls, and
* reduce the load on the REST API server.
fields.summary: Add a Connect context param for user's permissions to repo (BB-15089)

fields.description:
Confirmed in Chrome, firefox, safari, and IE on OSX.

Steps to reproduce:

# Open a merged PR.
# Click on the {{All tasks resolved}} link in the top right of the page.
# Click the small chain-link icon to the right of one of the completed tasks.
# A {{Comments on prior versions}} modal will pop up, showing any comments.
# Click on the {{Reply}} link under any comment. (tested & reproduced using both)
# Type in a {{@...}} user reference (in my case {{@donal}}), and after a second or 2, the pop up modal will disappear, and the page will become stale.  There is nowhere to add input\\
since the dialogue box is gone.

Only way to get out of it, is to go back to the original pr.

Screenshare added to internal issue.
fields.summary: Mentioning a user on a completed task in a PR causes the page to disable input. (BB-15053)

fields.description: Currently, it does not seem possible via the repo API endpoints, or issue tracker endpoints to set the issue tracker to private/public.
fields.summary: Add the ability to set issue tracker to private/public via API.

fields.description: Pulling via SSH is really really slow today.
fields.summary: SSH is very slow

fields.description: Seems to be a resolution issue, as this issue occurs no matter what browser you try on the iPad.  This makes it impossible to enter, or edit any Webhook data.
fields.summary: Unable to enter data using iPad for the Manage Webhooks page

fields.description:
The comment editor is not keeping carriage returns between edit mode & preview mode.\\
What's reflected in preview is accurate to what gets displayed after the comment is saved.

Please see attachment for more details.
fields.summary: Comment editor not keeping carriage returns

fields.description:
I'd like to allow lead developers to be able to give other users access to the repos of the projects they lead.

E.g. we have "Good Lead Developer" who is not a company (i.e. Bitbucket team)-wide admin, but leads "Big Project". Now we have a "Big Project developers" user group with write access to all the Big Project repos. I'd like to allow Good Lead Developer to be able to add new users (from the team) to the Big Project developers user group. I don't want Good Lead Developer to be able to similarly administer any other user group and I don't want project team members to be added directly to repos (instead of user groups).

This doesn't seem to be possible now: you can either give a user group full admin access to all repos of a team, or the group can have admin access to certain repositories. The latter one however is not sufficient: this way they could only add people to the repos directly, not via user groups (which is generally a bad practice).

Maybe BCLOUD-2323 will also solve this?
fields.summary: Allow certain non-admin Bitbucket users to add users to certain groups (BB-15037)

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
In a Pull Request, the source (S) and destination (D) branch are visible for the PR reviewer.\\
However, certain commits in branch S may be a merge from another branch (A) into branch S.

The PR reviewer may not want code from branch A to be merged to branch D, but the only way for him/her to find out, is to view each commit seperately.

This information (the branch of each commit in S) is not available in the Pull Requests >> Commits list.

h3. Example for a Mercurial Repository
We have a Pull Request from branch featureA to branch default

!949581715-Screen%20Shot%202015-11-13%20at%2012.42.31.png|thumbnail!

Commits 659dd70 and 9454ff8 originally belonged to branch test_fix, not featureA. However, there is no way for the reviewer to know that by viewing the Commits list, they will have to view each commit, one by one

!51527837-Screen%20Shot%202015-11-13%20at%2012.29.55.png|thumbnail!

!3321089215-Screen%20Shot%202015-11-13%20at%2012.30.13.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
In a Pull Request >> Commits list, add a Column 'Branch/es' that shows which branch each commit belongs to.
fields.summary: As a user I want to see the branch of each commit in Pull Requests >> Commits list in Bitbucket (BB-15038)

fields.description:
We like to keep commit history linear, so it would be really nice to see directly from pull request if it is on top of destination branch and prevent merging if it was not.

Branches where merges that are not directly to top of branch could be listed in "Branch Management" settings.
fields.summary: Option to not allow merge unless source branch is rebased on top of destination (BB-15039)

fields.description:
On page https://bitbucket.org/<org>/<repo>/commits/all the Next and Prev links contains incorrectly encoded ? (question mark) to %3F.

These links doesn't show the requested page, they show only the first page.

Broken link: https://bitbucket.org/<org>/<repo>/commits/all%3Fpage=2

Correct link: https://bitbucket.org/<org>/<repo>/commits/all?page=2
fields.summary: Commit page doesn't work (BB-14994)

fields.description: When using https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/{accountname}/{repo_slug}/branches/ I'm getting a 500 error for one particular repo. I know it has a lot of branches so I'm assuming the request times out before the server can come back with a response. Is there anything I can do to give the request more time or some other method I can use to get this data?
fields.summary: Request timeout when getting branches (api v 1)
